body:
You need to refer to Shard() for the proper value of this argument.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/work_sharder.h#L34

"cost_per_unit" is an estimate of the number of CPU cycles (or nanoseconds if not CPU-bound) to complete a unit of work.

The value "500" means each Traverse takes 0.5ms on average, IOW, 2000 traverse calls (or 2000 records) are done per second. Is it a fair estimate?

body_text:
You need to refer to Shard() for the proper value of this argument.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/util/work_sharder.h#L34
"cost_per_unit" is an estimate of the number of CPU cycles (or nanoseconds if not CPU-bound) to complete a unit of work.
The value "500" means each Traverse takes 0.5ms on average, IOW, 2000 traverse calls (or 2000 records) are done per second. Is it a fair estimate?
